variable.name: base-address
variable.description: Base address of ATD/ADC

variable.name: vih
variable.description: High Voltage Threshold

variable.name: vil
variable.description: Low Voltage Threshold

variable.name: base-address
variable.description: Base address of ATD/ADC

variable.name: vih
variable.description: High Voltage Threshold

variable.name: vil
variable.description: Low Voltage Threshold

variable.name: osc-ok
variable.description: A number greater equal than 4096 rising OSCCLK edges within a check window is called osc ok.

variable.name: osc-fail
variable.description: Oscillator instrument. Used to emulate oscillator fail and trigger the clock monitor.

variable.name: check_window
variable.description: A time window of 50,000 VCO clock cycles is called check window. VCO clock cycles are generated by the PLL when running at minimum frequency Fscm.

variable.name: pll-stabilization-delay
variable.description: Total PLL stabilization delay (acquisition + tracking). e.g. for Fosc = 4MHz and REFDV = #$00, SYNR = #$09 the acquisition_delay = 0.09 ms and tracking_delay = 0.16 ms

variable.name: param-self-clock-mode-clock
variable.description: Self Clock Mode frequency between 1MHz and 5.5 MHz (unit PS)

variable.name: built-in-signal-generator-enable
variable.description: Use built-in signal generator or external instrument

variable.name: built-in-signal-generator-period
variable.description: Built-in Signal generator period in pico-seconds. Default 25000ps.

variable.name: org
variable.description: memory origin/base address

variable.name: bytesize
variable.description: memory size in bytes

variable.name: cycle-time
variable.description: memory cycle time

variable.name: read-latency
variable.description: memory read latency

variable.name: write-latency
variable.description: memory write latency

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: flash-nonvolatile-byte-address
variable.description: Flash non-volatile (option) byte address

variable.name: min-fclk-time
variable.description: Specify minimum frequency of FTM

variable.name: max-fclk-time
variable.description: Specify maximum frequency of FTM

variable.name: version
variable.description: MMC version. Supported are V3 and V4. Default is V3

variable.name: interrupt-offset
variable.description: MPU Access Error interrupt

variable.name: org
variable.description: memory origin/base address

variable.name: bytesize
variable.description: memory size in bytes

variable.name: cycle-time
variable.description: memory cycle time

variable.name: read-latency
variable.description: memory read latency

variable.name: write-latency
variable.description: memory write latency

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: version
variable.description: XGATE version. Supported are V2 and V3. Default is V2

variable.name: base-address
variable.description: XGATE base Address

variable.name: software_channel_id[0]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[1]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[2]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[3]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[4]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[5]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[6]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software_channel_id[7]
variable.description: XGATE channel ID associated to software trigger. Determined on chip integration level (see Interrupts section of the SoC Guide.

variable.name: software-error-interrupt
variable.description: XGATE Software error interrupt

variable.name: filename
variable.description: the ELF filename to load into memory

variable.name: base-addr
variable.description: if force-base-addr is true force base address for a unique program segment, otherwise ignored

variable.name: force-base-addr
variable.description: if true force base address for a unique program segment

variable.name: force-use-virtual-address
variable.description: force use of virtual addresses instead of physical addresses (default false)

variable.name: initialize-extra-segment-bytes
variable.description: whether to initialize extra bytes in segments (p_filesz < p_memsz) to zero (true for standard ELF files)

variable.name: dump-headers
variable.description: dump headers while loading ELF file

variable.name: verbose
variable.description: enable/disable verbosity

variable.name: dwarf-to-html-output-directory
variable.description: DWARF v2/v3 to HTML output directory

variable.name: dwarf-to-xml-output-filename
variable.description: DWARF v2/v3 to XML output filename

variable.name: dwarf-register-number-mapping-filename
variable.description: DWARF register number mapping filename

variable.name: parse-dwarf
variable.description: Enable/Disable parsing of DWARF debugging informations

variable.name: debug-dwarf
variable.description: Enable/Disable debugging of DWARF

variable.name: enable-gdb-server
variable.description: Enable/Disable GDB server instantiation

variable.name: enable-inline-debugger
variable.description: Enable/Disable inline debugger instantiation

variable.name: enable-pim-server
variable.description: Enable/Disable PIM server instantiation

variable.name: enable-press-enter-at-exit
variable.description: Enable/Disable pressing key enter at exit

variable.name: endian
variable.description: Target endianness

variable.name: kernel_logger.file
variable.description: Keep logger output in a file

variable.name: kernel_logger.filename
variable.description: Filename to keep logger output _(the option file must be activated)

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_err
variable.description: Show logger output through the standard error output

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_err_color
variable.description: Colorize logger output through the standard error output _(only works if std_err is active)

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_out
variable.description: Show logger output through the standard output

variable.name: kernel_logger.std_out_color
variable.description: Colorize logger output through the standard output _(only works if std_out is active)

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_file
variable.description: Keep logger output in a file xml formatted

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_file_gzipped
variable.description: If the xml_file option is active, the output file will be compressed (a .gz extension will be automatically added to the xml_filename option

variable.name: kernel_logger.xml_filename
variable.description: Filename to keep logger xml output _(the option xml_file must be activated)

variable.name: program-counter-name
variable.description: Target CPU program counter name

variable.name: sci-enable-telnet
variable.description: SCI Enable/Disable telnet instantiation

variable.name: spi-enable-telnet
variable.description: SPI Enable/Disable telnet instantiation
